item.title: Fun with Static Site Generators and Travis
item.description: Overview If you use a static website generator, then you may be aware of the pain that goes into getting everything automated and pushed out to github pages on each commit. The manual workflow goes something like this: code your site using asciidoc/markdown/haml/sass/less/etc preprocessor (or build) generates static site (locally on your machine) copy static site to your local gh-pages or username.github.com repo/branch git push new site done Now, with a little scripting we can have:
